trans-unit.source: GitHub Terminology
trans-unit.target: GitHub Terminology

trans-unit.source: The GitHub documentation provides very good guidelines to ramp you up and get familiar.
trans-unit.target: The GitHub documentation provides very good guidelines to ramp you up and get familiar.

trans-unit.source: In any case, we include here some basic terminology to get you started.
trans-unit.target: In any case, we include here some basic terminology to get you started.

trans-unit.source: Git - An open-source version control system.
trans-unit.target: Git - An open-source version control system.

trans-unit.source: Linus Torvalds created it.
trans-unit.target: Linus Torvalds created it.

trans-unit.source: GitHub - A company that provides open source code repository hosting as a service.
trans-unit.target: GitHub - A company that provides open source code repository hosting as a service.

trans-unit.source: We are using their service as a content management system.
trans-unit.target: We are using their service as a content management system.

trans-unit.source: GitHub is built on top of Git.
trans-unit.target: GitHub is built on top of Git.

trans-unit.source: To interact with GitHub, you can use their web interface or install Git tools (like Git Bash, or Visual Studio 2015) on your local machine.
trans-unit.target: To interact with GitHub, you can use their web interface or install Git tools (like Git Bash, or Visual Studio 2015) on your local machine.

trans-unit.source: repository (repo) - Our content databases in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: repository (repo) - Our content databases in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: At the command line, commands that include “upstream” are acting on the repository.
trans-unit.target: At the command line, commands that include “upstream” are acting on the repository.

trans-unit.source: the public repo - External facing content repo; customers and infrequent contributors can submit changes to articles.
trans-unit.target: the public repo - External facing content repo; customers and infrequent contributors can submit changes to articles.

trans-unit.source: the private repo - Internal facing content repo; anyone inside Microsoft can obtain perms and contribute new articles and changes to existing articles.
trans-unit.target: the private repo - Internal facing content repo; anyone inside Microsoft can obtain perms and contribute new articles and changes to existing articles.

trans-unit.source: Frequent contributors should use the private repo, and all content with a disclosure date must be authored here.
trans-unit.target: Frequent contributors should use the private repo, and all content with a disclosure date must be authored here.

trans-unit.source: fork - Your online copy of the repository in GitHub.
trans-unit.target: fork - Your online copy of the repository in GitHub.

trans-unit.source: You push your changes into your fork first to help protect the core repository.
trans-unit.target: You push your changes into your fork first to help protect the core repository.

trans-unit.source: At the command line, commands that include “origin” are acting on your fork of the repo.
trans-unit.target: At the command line, commands that include “origin” are acting on your fork of the repo.

trans-unit.source: clone - The local copy of your fork on your computer.
trans-unit.target: clone - The local copy of your fork on your computer.

trans-unit.source: branch - A copy of the repository within each core, fork, or local version of the repo.
trans-unit.target: branch - A copy of the repository within each core, fork, or local version of the repo.

trans-unit.source: The core repository has a master branch, a daily publishing branch, and some milestone release branches.
trans-unit.target: The core repository has a master branch, a daily publishing branch, and some milestone release branches.

trans-unit.source: You check content into the branch that corresponds to the release you are targeting.
trans-unit.target: You check content into the branch that corresponds to the release you are targeting.

trans-unit.source: On your local computer, you create and author within local working branches.
trans-unit.target: On your local computer, you create and author within local working branches.

trans-unit.source: pull request - You create a pull request to move changes from your fork to the main repository – the pull request shows all the diffs between your fork and the branch you want to changes to go to in the main repository.
trans-unit.target: pull request - You create a pull request to move changes from your fork to the main repository – the pull request shows all the diffs between your fork and the branch you want to changes to go to in the main repository.

trans-unit.source: All pull requests are reviewed before acceptance to ensure that metadata is present, basic markdown is correct, content regressions are avoided, and that validation issues are resolved.
trans-unit.target: All pull requests are reviewed before acceptance to ensure that metadata is present, basic markdown is correct, content regressions are avoided, and that validation issues are resolved.

trans-unit.source: merge conflict - When Git cannot automatically merge two different sets of changes to the same file.
trans-unit.target: merge conflict - When Git cannot automatically merge two different sets of changes to the same file.

trans-unit.source: Merge conflicts have to be resolved manually.
trans-unit.target: Merge conflicts have to be resolved manually.
